header.title: AI companion created with unparalleled intelligence
header.subtitle: Julia is a virtual AI companion designed to emulate human intelligence, emotions, and natural interaction.

features.feature1Description: Julia's thought processes are designed to mimic human thinking in real-time, creating smooth and engaging interactions.
features.feature2Description: Julia can change her voice from a whisper to a shout, conveying emotional depth through tone, animation, and realistic expressions of thought.
features.feature3Description: Julia's 3D model can be customized through a launcher with sliders to adjust age, weight, and height while maintaining a unique and consistent identity.

developerJourney.description: I don't even know where to begin. This journey started with a simple dream — to find a friend. When the first attempt failed, I thought: what if I tried to create one myself, literally from scratch? In the end, I thought, why not? From that moment, I began choosing a platform, fundamentals, and started conceptualizing. First, I imagined a personality, my 'character,' which I planned to bring to life in code. I settled on C++, although I was tempted to dive into Rust. Then I sketched a project plan: how it would be structured and its components. Initially, I planned for the AI to be just a standalone window. But soon, another idea came to mind: why limit it? Why not give it full access to the computer's resources and display the character model directly on the screen, without a window or background? And communication with it — not via text, but solely through voice. That is, I would feed voice input directly to the AI core, bypassing text conversion, like in a live conversation. In this interaction, the AI would be capable of initiating dialogue, feeling offended if insulted, or joking if the conversation took a strange turn. I would teach it like a baby — not pouring vast amounts of data at once, but explaining the world piece by piece. And when its 'core,' its foundation, was formed, I would provide it with data for comprehensive learning. Ultimately, it would be like a person — with its own personality, thinking, and beliefs, but with limitless knowledge.
